name: alfalfa hay production; bailed, stored outside; on farm; dry matter
description: This unit process represents the alfalfa hay produced on the Roman L. Hruska U.S. Meat Animal Research Center (MARC) in Nebraska in 2011.

category.name: ISIC 0119: Growing of other non-perennial crops

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Operations were modeled using IFSM and intended to be representative of conditions in 2011.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Irrigated alfalfa hay production at the MARC farm. Includes arable land use based on yield. Includes energy  use like diesel and gasoline for on farm equipment.
processDocumentation.dataCollectionDescription: Data for this project were collected from 2015 through 2017.
processDocumentation.completenessDescription: Emissions and resource use were simulated using the Integrated Farm System Model (IFSM). IFSM gives emissions for the whole farm, not per crop. Therefore, emissions resulting from all crop production are included in the cattle feed production mix process and not individual crop processes. Fate and transport of active ingredients in pesticides and heavy metals from fertilizers are not included. Impacts associated with the manufacture or maintenance of capital goods, chemotherapeutics, or cleaning agents were not considered. Impacts from upstream production of input flows like fertilizers and electricity require a connection to DataSmart.
processDocumentation.dataSelectionDescription: Data were selected from the MARC farm because, as a research facility, detailed records were kept and made available for comparison to simulated values. The operational records were used to construct a simulation of the operation in IFSM. 25 years of simulations were run in IFSM with annual weather records and the average values from the 25 simulations proivded the LCI values.
processDocumentation.reviewDetails: LCA Commons Staff conducts a critical review of data set organization and documentation.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: "The beef production system of MARC was modeled as 4 components: crop farm, spring-calving cow– calf operation, fall-calving cow–calf operation, and feedlot. Production and economic information for 2011 was used to set parameters in IFSM for each of the 4 components. The accuracy of the simulated system was evaluated by comparing predicted feed production and use, energy use, and production costs to actual records of MARC for 2011." From Rotz et al. 2013
processDocumentation.inventoryMethodDescription: This process includes all of the alfalfa hay produced on the MARC farm in 2011. It is intended to be used in conjunction with the MARC farm beef cattle product system; however, not all of the hay was consumed by cattle. MARC farm records from 2011 indicate that 82.5% of the feeds produced on site were used in beef cattle operations. Therefore, 82.5% of impacts from crop production at the MARC farm are attributed to cattle production, which includes feed consumed in the cow-calf and finishing portions of the operation.
processDocumentation.modelingConstantsDescription: The dry matter output of 8093 tons represents the alfalfa hay produced in one year.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: This unit process is part of a product system for beef cattle production that was created using information from Rotz et al. 2013 among other sources. It is not the model used in that study; however, the authors from that study graciously provided assisstance in formatting their efforts into the OpenLCA platform.

processDocumentation.intendedApplication: These data were developed using IFSM and are intended to represent the MARC cattle operation in Nebraska in 2011. It is intended to be used in conjunction with the beef cattle product system and therefore includes corn consumed by all animals at the operation. This data set was developed for use in Situation C2: Accounting, excluding interactions with other systems (ILCD Handbook).
processDocumentation.projectDescription: This dataset was created as part of a project at the University of Arkansas and was funded by the National Cattleman's Beef Association
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Operations were modeled using IFSM and intended to be representative of conditions at the MARC farm in Nebraska.

publication.name: Rotz et al. 2013 A simulation-based approach for evaluating and comparing the environmental footprints of beef production systems

sources.name: Rotz et al. 2013 A simulation-based approach for evaluating and comparing the environmental footprints of beef production systems

flow.name: alfalfa hay; bailed, stored outside; on farm; dry matter
categoryPath: ISIC 0119: Growing of other non-perennial crops
